http://www.365gay.com/Newscon06/10/102406walmart.htm
 
 The AFA is asking shoppers to shop at other establishments, other than Wal-Mart "for their support of the gay "agenda". From reading here for some time, I thought it was only about the acting out on homosexualality they had a problem with. and 
 
 p.s. I think I'll go to Wal-mart and and give my support. There is such a thing as the "gay" dollar and it can't be ignored.

Well its about time Walmart did something I like.
 
 Gays have spending power. Not many sane companies are going to ignore that for long. My company doesn't - treats them as viable market. My company also has domestic partner benefits, openly gay employees (including upper management) and is the largest corporate sponsor of PRIDE in my city every year.

""They'll come up with hundreds, sometimes even thousands of products relating to homosexuality [and promotion of] the agenda of the homosexual community," Sharp told Christian publication Agape."
 
 I would be fascintaed, and probably highly amused, to see what products they think are promoting the homosexual agenda. It would probably be a wonderful peek inside their rather twisted little minds. I mean, what are they talking about? Astroglide? Silk boxers? Potted ferns? The mind boggles at what they might be afraid of here. Oh noes! My son just saw a Teletubbies tape on that rack, now he's going to catch gayness!!

I'm curious how many people ACTUALLY boycott Ford based on the AFA's statements.
 
 Quite frankly, if the AFA were SERIOUS about their "boycott" XXXX, they would be boycotting a LOT more stores. I'ld be curious to hear from them how Wal-Mart and Target etc significantly differ on "gay-friendly"...
 
 All bark and no real bite.

I'm curious how many people ACTUALLY boycott Ford based on the AFA's statements.

 
 Essentially none. At least, there was no finanicial impact. Ford knows that biggotry doesn't pay, and every time an issue like this comes up at stockholders meetings the shareholders vote in favor of opposing biggotry. You'ld think AFA might have learned from their failure with Ford, or then again you might not. :)
Does anyone have a link to a story on this from a more mainstream news source?

Does anyone have a link to a story on this from a more mainstream news source?

 
 If you're looking for a specific spin, or looking to avoid a specific spin, than you'll have to do your own research. I use news.google. Type in your search terms and it'll give you a bunch of different news sites; pick the one that suits your tastes.

I can't help but laugh. 
 
 Cost leadership triumphs any moral claims aganist a company in America. 
 
 Walmart does terrible stuff to their employees. We still buy.
 That ghetto resturant that is dirty? We still go there because it's cheap
 Clothing manufactures that hire 13 year olds who work their fingers to the bone? We buy their stuff in droves. (Yes I support sweatshops because it's better then prositution)
 
 $ < Morals in America.

Does anyone have a link to a story on this from a more mainstream news source?

 
If you're looking for a specific spin, or looking to avoid a specific spin, than you'll have to do your own research. I use news.google. Type in your search terms and it'll give you a bunch of different news sites; pick the one that suits your tastes.

 
 I wouldn't be surprised if a lot of the "mainstream" news sources just avoided giving the AFA more press.
 Just because some bigotted group farts doesn't mean it's newsworthy.
 Should we follow the Phelps crew around as well and report their status on the 11:00 news?
 
 The AFA has been harping on Wal-Mart for a while now. A new proclamation from them on the subject is just boring in some ways.
 
 After a while, it just gets old hearing how anti-gay people don't want others to be tolerant of gays...

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  AFA: Avoid Gay Friendly Wal-Mart
